audio_description: Assalamualaikum, friends. Biryani is made in many ways, and each city and state has its own style. Today we’re making a very simple Mughlai Chicken Biryani, easily made at home.

audio_description: ...lemon juice. Mix everything well and set aside for 30 minutes. In a wok, heat some oil, add 3 green cardamoms, 3 cloves, and 1 black cardamom.

audio_description: Once the onions are golden brown, add the marinated chicken. Cook on high flame for 4–5 minutes, then cover and cook for 20–25 minutes until the chicken is tender.

audio_description: Add nutmeg and mace powder, mix everything, and cook for 1–2 minutes. The chicken masala is now ready. See how simple it was?

audio_description: We’re using 400g of basmati rice, boiled with bay leaf, cumin seeds, lemon juice, and a bit of oil. Cooked about 95%. You can see the grains are separate.

audio_description: Add a little mint, then layer the rest of the rice. Pour about 1/4 cup milk, 1 tbsp melted ghee, and the same nutmeg-mace powder on top.

audio_description: Add about 1 tsp kewra water and some fried onions. Cover tightly with silver foil and steam on high for 1 minute, then on low for 12–15 minutes.
